dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4768 IH: Health Care Fairness for Military Families Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Ryan (for himself, Mrs. Kiggans of Virginia, Mr. Finstad, Ms. Sherrill, Mr. Moylan, Ms. Tokuda, Mr. Davis of North Carolina, Mr. Sorensen, Mr. Bell, Mr. Carter of Louisiana, Ms. Elfreth, Mr. Foster, Ms. Houlahan, Mr. Morelle, Ms. Underwood, Ms. Salinas, Ms. Ross, Ms. Titus, Mr. Courtney, Mr. Keating, Mr. Cohen, Mr. Boyle of Pennsylvania, Mr. Deluzio, Ms. Strickland, Ms. Scanlon, Mr. Evans of Pennsylvania, Ms. DeGette, Ms. Goodlander, Mr. McGovern, Mr. Horsford, Mr. Gottheimer, Mr. Costa, Mr. Moulton, Ms. Sewell, Ms. Schrier, Mr. Levin, Mr. Larsen of Washington, and Mr. Hamadeh of Arizona) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to improve dependent coverage under the TRICARE Young Adult Program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Health Care Fairness for Military Families Act of 2025.

section.header: Improvements to dependent coverage under TRICARE Young Adult Program

subsection.text: Subsection (b) of section 1110b of title 10, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (4) and (5) as paragraphs (3) and (4), respectively.

subsection.header: Elimination of separate premium for a young adult

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking In accordance with subsection (c), an individual and inserting An individual; and

subsection.text: Section 1075(c)(3) of title 10, United States Code, is amended by striking section 1076d, 1076e, or 1110b and inserting section 1076d or 1076e.
